name: 72b9d7d6-e8f9-4078-b86a-c5d0ce209410
displayName: Adding an attachment to a transaction

text.text: How do I add an attachment to a transaction?

text: To add an attachment to a transaction, you can use the "Finish later" or review window. You can also add attachments on any page in the incomplete claim workflow.

text.text: What permissions do I need to have to add attachments to a transaction?

text: To add an attachment to a transaction, you need to have payment posting permissions.

text.text: Can attachments be added to any type of transaction?

text: You can post an attachment to a "Resolve" claim even when the resolve action is not complete. You can also post an attachment to PLB adjustment claims.

text.text: What are the steps to attach a file to a transaction?

text: To attach a file to a transaction, you can use the "Attach file" button on the Attachments tab. You can also delete an attachment before or after the batch is posted.

text.text: What file types are supported for attachments?

text: You can edit and delete most attachment types. There are instances where you cannot – for example you cannot edit a NEMSISPCR file type. For attachment types that you cannot change, the edit and remove icons are grayed out.

text.text: Is there a limit to the number of attachments allowed per transaction?

text: There is a limit of five attachments allowed in any one transaction. After five, the "Attach file" button will disable.

text.text: What is the maximum file size allowed for each attachment?

text: The maximum file size for each attachment is 500 MB.

text.text: Can I edit or delete attachments after uploading them?

text: Yes, you can edit and delete most attachment types. There are instances where you cannot – for example you cannot edit a NEMSISPCR file type. For attachment types that you cannot change, the edit and remove icons are grayed out.

text.text: Where do attachments display after being added to a transaction?

text: Attachments are applied to claims within the transaction only after the transaction is successfully posted. If a transaction is reversed, the attachments will be deleted from all the claims in the transaction.

text.text: Can attachments be added to claims before the transaction is posted?

text: Yes, adding an attachment is available up until the transaction is posted. At that time, you cannot add an attachment.

text.text: What happens to attachments if a transaction is reversed?

text: If a transaction is reversed, the attachments will be deleted from all the claims in the transaction.

text.text: Are attachments applied to all claims within a transaction?

text: Yes, attachments are applied to all claims within a transaction.

text.text: Can I add attachments to "Resolve" claims even if the resolve action is not complete?

text: Yes, you can post an attachment to a "Resolve" claim even when the resolve action is not complete. You can also post an attachment to PLB adjustment claims.

text.text: Is it possible to post attachments to PLB adjustment claims?

text: Yes, you can post an attachment to PLB adjustment claims. You can also post an attachment to a "Resolve" claim even when the resolve action is not complete. Attachments are applied to all claims within a transaction only after the transaction is successfully posted. You cannot post an attachment to an ignored claim.

text.text: How can I delete an attachment from a transaction?

text: You can delete an attachment from a transaction by clicking the X icon on the attachment line and then clicking Delete attachment on the confirmation pop-up window. You can also delete an attachment by clicking the X under the Delete column.

text.text: Will deleting an attachment from a transaction also remove it from associated claims?

text: Yes, deleting an attachment from a transaction will also remove it from all the claims within the transaction.

text.text: Can attachments be added to ignored claims?

text: You cannot post an attachment to an ignored claim.

text.text: What happens to transaction notes if a transaction is reversed?

text: If a transaction is reversed, the transaction notes on all associated claims will be deleted. After posting the transaction, a note cannot be edited but can be removed. If it is removed, it is removed from all claims associated with the transaction. Deleting a transaction note will result in an audit entry.

text.text: Are entries made in the audit trail when adding or deleting attachments?

text: Yes, entries are made in the audit trail when adding or deleting attachments.

text.text: What restrictions apply to editing attachments on claims within a transaction?

text: You cannot add an attachment to a transaction after it is posted. You can delete an attachment either before or after the batch is posted. However, deleting the attachment after the batch is posted will remove it from all the claims within the transaction. Attachments are applied to claims within the transaction only after the transaction is successfully posted.

text.text: How to Add attachments to a transaction?

text: A user with payment posting permissions can now add an attachment to a transaction in the "Finish later" or review window. You can post an attachment to a "Resolve" claim even when the resolve action is not complete. You can also post an attachment to PLB adjustment claims.

text.text: when can an attachment be deleted?

text: If a transaction is reversed, the attachments will be deleted from all the claims in the transaction. Entries in the audit trail will be made when an attachment is added or deleted from a claim. You cannot post an attachment to an ignored claim.
